rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about family budgets.

Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things!

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family‚Äôs goals.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about family budgets.

Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things!

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family‚Äôs goals.

media_title.eng: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is family budgeting.

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family.

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.

rows.media_title: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is family budgeting.

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family.

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.

rows.text_1_facilitator: When we involve our teens in budgeting, they learn to be responsible with money and work towards goals. That is something we all want for our teens, right?

text_1_facilitator.eng: When we involve our teens in budgeting, they learn to be responsible with money and work towards goals. That is something we all want for our teens, right?

media_title.eng: Hear how @data.characters.media_male_4.name involved his teens in budgeting

media_transcript.eng:
My teens used to ask for many things and couldn‚Äôt understand when I said, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have money for that right now.‚Äù They would say, ‚ÄúBut you have a job!‚Äù

One day I sat with them and showed them all our monthly costs and how much is left. After that, they understood. Now they even share ideas on how we can save for small goals, like new shoes or birthdays, and bigger things like school fees. For my older one, I also opened a savings account.

Budgeting together has made me realise that it‚Äôs not just earning money that is important but actually showing up as a father. This has made me feel less stressed and less alone with the money worries, because now we plan together as a family.

rows.media_title: Hear how @data.characters.media_male_4.name involved his teens in budgeting
rows.media_transcript:
My teens used to ask for many things and couldn‚Äôt understand when I said, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have money for that right now.‚Äù They would say, ‚ÄúBut you have a job!‚Äù

One day I sat with them and showed them all our monthly costs and how much is left. After that, they understood. Now they even share ideas on how we can save for small goals, like new shoes or birthdays, and bigger things like school fees. For my older one, I also opened a savings account.

Budgeting together has made me realise that it‚Äôs not just earning money that is important but actually showing up as a father. This has made me feel less stressed and less alone with the money worries, because now we plan together as a family.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem!

Including @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name, who have been taking care of their grandchildren, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name, since their parents died when they were young.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem!

Including @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name, who have been taking care of their grandchildren, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name, since their parents died when they were young.

character_1_text.eng: I am so stressed. We don‚Äôt have any money left. And now I am fighting with @data.characters.f2_son_15.name over things he wants ‚Äì again.

character_2_text.eng: I am also worried. I don‚Äôt think we will be able to pay off our last debt this month like we wanted to.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Dealing with money challenges, like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name's situation, is stressful. 

A family budget can help them ‚Äì and YOU!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Dealing with money challenges, like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name's situation, is stressful. 

A family budget can help them ‚Äì and YOU!

text_2.eng:

üí≠ Step 1: THINK

rows.text_1_facilitator:
**Step 1: THINK**
Think about what you spend money on each month.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
**Step 1: THINK**
Think about what you spend money on each month.

text_2.eng:
- Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
- Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month (there is no need to share the numbers if you don‚Äôt want to).
- Add up how much money you have to spend each month.

rows.text_2:
- Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
- Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month (there is no need to share the numbers if you don‚Äôt want to).
- Add up how much money you have to spend each month.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
**Step 2: CHOOSE**
Think about your needs and wants.
- WANT is something you can live without. 
- NEED is something you cannot live without.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
**Step 2: CHOOSE**
Think about your needs and wants.
- WANT is something you can live without. 
- NEED is something you cannot live without.

text_2.eng:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:

- Which are NEEDS that you cannot live without? Why?
- Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why?
- Which things could you try to spend less money on?

rows.text_2:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:

- Which are NEEDS that you cannot live without? Why?
- Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why?
- Which things could you try to spend less money on?

text_2.eng:
- Write down what your income is for the month.
- Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. For example: If your income is TSh2000 and you have 20 beans, each bean is TSh100.
- Decide what you will spend on, and put the stones/objects on that image.

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That‚Äôs totally fine! This exercise will get easier with practice.

rows.text_2:
- Write down what your income is for the month.
- Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. For example: If your income is TSh2000 and you have 20 beans, each bean is TSh100.
- Decide what you will spend on, and put the stones/objects on that image.

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? That‚Äôs totally fine! This exercise will get easier with practice.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
**Step 4: PLAN**
Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
**Step 4: PLAN**
Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!

text_2.eng:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergencies, it can make a big difference over time.

- Add a circle called ‚Äúemergencies‚Äù.
- Add a circle called ‚Äúfamily goals‚Äù.
- Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for goals and emergencies.

rows.text_2:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergencies, it can make a big difference over time.

- Add a circle called ‚Äúemergencies‚Äù.
- Add a circle called ‚Äúfamily goals‚Äù.
- Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for goals and emergencies.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Now, let's see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name made a plan with their money, just like you are doing:

text_1_facilitator.eng: Now, let's see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name made a plan with their money, just like you are doing:

character_1_text.eng: We want the best future for our grandchildren, but I do not know where to get the money.

character_2_text.eng: Me neither. Loan sharks are dangerous, and paying them back is very expensive.

rows.character_1_text: We want the best future for our grandchildren, but I do not know where to get the money.
rows.character_2_text: Me neither. Loan sharks are dangerous, and paying them back is very expensive.

rows.character_1_text: I‚Äôd love for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name to go to high school.

character_1_text.eng: I‚Äôd love for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name to go to high school.

character_2_text.eng: Yes! And @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name to university! But how can we save that much money with the little money we get?

rows.character_2_text: Yes! And @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name to university! But how can we save that much money with the little money we get?

rows.character_1_text: I know ‚Äî let‚Äôs start with a plan! Maybe we can make a budget and see how we can save our money.

character_1_text.eng: I know ‚Äî let‚Äôs start with a plan! Maybe we can make a budget and see how we can save our money.

character_2_text.eng: That‚Äôs a great idea. We can save a little bit at a time ‚Äî I will even join a savings group.

character_3_text.eng: We should talk with our grandchildren about things we can spend a little less on. They can help us choose what is a need and what is a want.

rows.character_2_text: That‚Äôs a great idea. We can save a little bit at a time ‚Äî I will even join a savings group.
rows.character_3_text: We should talk with our grandchildren about things we can spend a little less on. They can help us choose what is a need and what is a want.

character_1_text.eng: Look, we reached our dreams! We did not borrow any money from friends or loan sharks.

character_2_text.eng: By saving a tiny bit each week, we managed to pay for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name‚Äôs high school and save some money for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name‚Äôs university. I am so proud of this.

rows.character_1_text: Look, we reached our dreams! We did not borrow any money from friends or loan sharks.
rows.character_2_text: By saving a tiny bit each week, we managed to pay for @data.characters.f2_son_15.name‚Äôs high school and save some money for @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name‚Äôs university. I am so proud of this.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Having a savings plan could have helped @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name to be prepared for this kind of emergency! 

There are different ways we can save: at home, by buying things we can sell for profit, at a bank, or in a stokvel.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Having a savings plan could have helped @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name to be prepared for this kind of emergency! 

There are different ways we can save: at home, by buying things we can sell for profit, at a bank, or in a stokvel.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.

character_1_text.eng: One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.

quiz_1_question.eng: What is the best way your family can save?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Any savings plan you choose can help your family.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Buy things you can sell for profit

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Any savings plan you choose can help your family.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Any savings plan you choose can help your family.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Any savings plan you choose can help your family.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are this week‚Äôs takeaway skills to help you budget and save!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are this week‚Äôs takeaway skills to help you budget and save!

section_1_text.eng:
*What do we spend on now?*

Write down or draw what you spend money on as a family each month.

How much does each item cost?
How much money do you need in total?

section_2_text.eng:
*Talk together about needs and wants.*

Which expenses are a ‚Äòneed‚Äô that you cannot live without?
Which expenses are a ‚Äòwant‚Äô that is nice to have but not essential?
Which things could you try to spend less on?

When we explain and listen to each other carefully, we can make good money choices together as a family.

section_3_text.eng:
*Make your own budget.*

Write down your income for the month.

Take stones, beans, or anything with lots of bits - this is your income.
Agree how much you will spend on each item, and put the objects on that image/word.

section_4_text.eng:
*Plan for emergencies and family goals.*

Draw a circle ‚Äòemergencies‚Äô.
Draw a circle ‚Äòsaving‚Äô.
Move your ‚Äòmoney‚Äô around so you can save a bit every month for both.

section_4_extra_text.eng: Remind your teen to always tell you or a trusted adult if someone offers them gifts, airtime, money, or deals that are ‚Äòtoo good to be true‚Äô especially if asked for photos, favours, or to keep secrets.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
We all have dreams for our family, just like @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name. By setting aside a bit of money every month, you can realise them too!

Let‚Äôs come up with some ideas for savings goals for you to make a budget plan.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This week's home practice is to make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family!

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This week's home practice is to make a budget again - this time WITH your teen and family!

This is an important and fun thing to do with your family - it takes about 30 minutes.

text_2.eng:
**Remember to use the four steps for doing a family budget:**

üí≠ Step 1: THINK (what do we spend on now?)
üéØ Step 2: CHOOSE (what are our needs and wants?)
‚öíÔ∏è Step 3: BUILD (make your budget) 
üìã Step 4: PLAN (plan for emergencies and family goals)

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you make a budget with your family this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Wonderful! Making a family budget is a powerful way to set goals and reduce stress together. Keep it simple and celebrate every small success

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That‚Äôs a great start! Even talking about money as a family is a big step. Take it one conversation at a time - you are building important skills together.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. Budgeting can feel difficult at first. Try starting with one small thing, like planning how to spend this week‚Äôs food money, and build from there.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
When we involve teens in budgeting, they learn important life skills, like understanding the difference between needs and wants.

Making a budget together also helps teens see that we all need to make hard choices sometimes, but that it helps us to have enough money at the end of the month - and to realise our goals!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
When we involve teens in budgeting, they learn important life skills, like understanding the difference between needs and wants.

Making a budget together also helps teens see that we all need to make hard choices sometimes, but that it helps us to have enough money at the end of the month - and to realise our goals!

media_title.eng: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more

media_transcript.eng:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say ‚ÄúI do not have money,‚Äù but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point ‚Äúshe does not love me.‚Äù

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked ‚Äúwhat are the needs and wants in our house.‚Äù I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family.

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.

rows.media_title: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more
rows.media_transcript:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say ‚ÄúI do not have money,‚Äù but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point ‚Äúshe does not love me.‚Äù

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked ‚Äúwhat are the needs and wants in our house.‚Äù I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family.

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.
